csharp_simple:
1using System;
2using System.Collections.Generic;
3​
4namespace TechnicalIndicators
5{
6 /// <summary>
7 /// Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP)
8 /// </summary>
9 /// <remarks>
10 /// A trading benchmark used by traders that gives the average price a security has traded at throughout the day, based on both volume and price.
11 /// <list type="bullet">
12 /// <item><description>Typical Price = (High + Low + Close) / 3.</description></item>
13 /// <item><description>VWAP = Sum(TypicalPrice * Volume) / Sum(Volume).</description></item>
14 /// <item><description>Cumulative from the start of the data (or session).</description></item>
15 /// </list>
16 /// </remarks>
17 public class VolumeWeightedAveragePrice
18 {
19 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
20​
21 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
22 {
23 Values.Clear();
24 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
25 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
26​
27 decimal cumulativeTypicalPriceVolume = 0;
28 decimal cumulativeVolume = 0;
29​
30 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
31 {
32 decimal typicalPrice = (candleList[i].High + candleList[i].Low + candleList[i].Close) / 3;
33 cumulativeTypicalPriceVolume += typicalPrice * candleList[i].Volume;
34 cumulativeVolume += candleList[i].Volume;
35​
36 if (cumulativeVolume == 0)
37 Values.Add(null);
38 else
39 Values.Add(cumulativeTypicalPriceVolume / cumulativeVolume);
40 }
41 }
42​
43 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
44 {
45 var vwap = new VolumeWeightedAveragePrice();
46 vwap.Calculate(candles);
47 return vwap.Values;
48 }
49 }
50}
csharp_detailed:
1// =============================================================================
2// VWAP (Volume Weighted Average Price) - ETM WebCode Tutorial
3// =============================================================================
4//
5// [What] VWAP is the cumulative average price weighted by volume.
6// It represents the "fair" average price where most shares traded.
7//
8// [Why] Institutional traders use VWAP as an execution benchmark.
9// Buying below VWAP = good execution, above = poor execution.
10//
11// [How] VWAP = Σ(TypicalPrice × Volume) / Σ(Volume)
12// TypicalPrice = (High + Low + Close) / 3
13//
14// =============================================================================
15// [Visual] VWAP Concept
16// =============================================================================
17//
18// Price
19// │
20// $55┤ ●────●
21// │ ●────●
22// $50┤───●────●────────────── VWAP (pulled up by high-volume days)
23// │ ●
24// $45┤ ●
25// └────────────────────────────────────────────
26// Time →
27//
28// [How] If price is ABOVE VWAP → Bullish bias (buyers in control)
29// If price is BELOW VWAP → Bearish bias (sellers in control)
30//
31// =============================================================================
32// [Visual] Typical Price Calculation
33// =============================================================================
34//
35// TypicalPrice = (High + Low + Close) / 3
36//
37// High: 105 ─────┐
38// │ │
39// Close: 103 ────┼── Average = (105+98+103)/3 = 102
40// │ │
41// Low: 98 ─────┘
42//
43// [Why] Uses all three prices to represent the "center" of the bar
44//
45// =============================================================================
46​
47using System;
48using System.Collections.Generic;
49​
50namespace TechnicalIndicators
51{
52 // =========================================================================
53 // [What] OHLCV Data Structure
54 // =========================================================================
55 public readonly record struct CandleData(
56 DateTime Timestamp,
57 decimal Open,
58 decimal High,
59 decimal Low,
60 decimal Close,
61 long Volume
62 );
63​
64 // =========================================================================
65 // [What] VWAP Indicator Class
66 // =========================================================================
67 public class VolumeWeightedAveragePrice
68 {
69 // =====================================================================
70 // [What] Output Storage
71 // =====================================================================
72 public List<decimal?> Values { get; } = new();
73​
74 // =====================================================================
75 // [What] Main Calculation Method
76 // =====================================================================
77 //
78 // IPO Block:
79 // Input : candles - OHLCV price history
80 // Process: Accumulate (TP × Volume) and Volume, compute ratio
81 // Output : Populates Values with cumulative VWAP
82 // =====================================================================
83 public void Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
84 {
85 Values.Clear();
86 var candleList = new List<CandleData>(candles);
87 if (candleList.Count == 0) return;
88​
89 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
90 // [What] Cumulative Accumulators
91 // [Why] VWAP is cumulative from session start, not rolling
92 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
93 decimal cumulativeTypicalPriceVolume = 0;
94 decimal cumulativeVolume = 0;
95​
96 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
97 // [Visual] VWAP Accumulation Loop
98 //
99 // for each bar:
100 // 1. TP = (H + L + C) / 3
101 // 2. cumTPV += TP × Volume
102 // 3. cumVol += Volume
103 // 4. VWAP = cumTPV / cumVol
104 // -----------------------------------------------------------------
105 for (int i = 0; i < candleList.Count; i++)
106 {
107 // [How] Calculate Typical Price
108 decimal typicalPrice = (candleList[i].High + candleList[i].Low + candleList[i].Close) / 3;
109​
110 // [How] Accumulate weighted price and volume
111 cumulativeTypicalPriceVolume += typicalPrice * candleList[i].Volume;
112 cumulativeVolume += candleList[i].Volume;
113​
114 // [How] Output VWAP (guard against zero volume)
115 if (cumulativeVolume == 0)
116 Values.Add(null);
117 else
118 Values.Add(cumulativeTypicalPriceVolume / cumulativeVolume);
119 }
120 }
121​
122 // =====================================================================
123 // [What] Static Convenience Method
124 // =====================================================================
125 public static List<decimal?> Calculate(IEnumerable<CandleData> candles)
126 {
127 var vwap = new VolumeWeightedAveragePrice();
128 vwap.Calculate(candles);
129 return vwap.Values;
130 }
131 }
132}
python_simple:
1class VolumeWeightedAveragePrice:
2 """
3 VWAP (Cumulative)
4 """
5 def __init__(self):
6 self.values = []
7​
8 def calculate(self, candles):
9 self.values.clear()
10 if not candles: return
11​
12 cum_tp_vol = 0.0
13 cum_vol = 0.0
14​
15 for i in range(len(candles)):
16 h = float(candles[i]['high'])
17 l = float(candles[i]['low'])
18 c = float(candles[i]['close'])
19 v = float(candles[i]['volume'])
20
21 tp = (h + l + c) / 3.0
22 cum_tp_vol += tp * v
23 cum_vol += v
24
25 if cum_vol == 0:
26 self.values.append(None)
27 else:
28 self.values.append(cum_tp_vol / cum_vol)
29​
30def calculate(candles):
31 obj = VolumeWeightedAveragePrice()
32 obj.calculate(candles)
33 return obj.values
python_detailed:
1# =============================================================================
2# Logic Breakdown (Volume Weighted Average Price)
3# =============================================================================
4#
5# This document provides a "Deep Dive" into the internal logic of the
6# Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP).
7#
8# [Core Concepts]
9# 1. Institutional Benchmark
10# - VWAP represents the "True Average Price" paid by the market.
11# - If you bought below VWAP, you beat the average participant (Good).
12# - If you bought above VWAP, you paid more than average (Bad).
13# - Algorithms try to execute close to VWAP.
14#
15# 2. Cumulative Nature
16# - Unlike Moving Averages, VWAP accumulates data from a "Start Time" (Anchor).
17# - Typically anchored to the Daily Open (resets every day).
18# - THIS IMPLEMENTATION assumes the input `candles` represents a single session
19# or the desired calculation window. It accumulates from index 0.
20#
21# [Formula]
22# TypicalPrice = (High + Low + Close) / 3
23# TP_Volume = TypicalPrice * Volume
24# VWAP = CumulativeSum(TP_Volume) / CumulativeSum(Volume)
25#
26# =============================================================================
27​
28# -------------------------------------------------------------
29# Type-Level Explanation: VolumeWeightedAveragePrice (class)
30#
31# [Why] Execution quality metric.
32# [What] Cumulative Volume-Weighted Average.
33# [How] Calculates the cumulative sum of (Typical Price * Volume) and divides it by the cumulative sum of Volume.
34# -------------------------------------------------------------
35class VolumeWeightedAveragePrice:
36
37 # -------------------------------------------------------------
38 # Constructor: __init__
39 # [Why] No "period" parameter because VWAP is cumulative (anchored).
40 # -------------------------------------------------------------
41 def __init__(self):
42 self.values = []
43​
44 # =============================================================================
45 # IPO: calculate
46 # =============================================================================
47 #
48 # [Input]
49 # - candles: List[dict] (Session data)
50 #
51 # [Process]
52 # 1. Init Cumulative Totals.
53 # 2. Iterate candles.
54 # 3. Calculate Typical Price.
55 # 4. Add (TP * Vol) to Cumulative Value.
56 # 5. Add Vol to Cumulative Volume.
57 # 6. Divide to get VWAP.
58 #
59 # [Output]
60 # - None.
61 # =============================================================================
62 def calculate(self, candles):
63
64 # -------------------------------------------------------------
65 # Logic Step 1: Reset
66 # [Why] Ensure a clean start for the calculation.
67 # [How] Clear the output list and check input validity.
68 # -------------------------------------------------------------
69 self.values.clear()
70 if len(candles) == 0:
71 return
72​
73 cum_tp_vol = 0.0 # Numerator
74 cum_vol = 0.0 # Denominator
75​
76 # -------------------------------------------------------------
77 # Logic Step 2: Main Loop
78 # [Why] Process each candle sequentially to build the cumulative totals.
79 # [How] Iterate through the candle list.
80 # -------------------------------------------------------------
81 for i in range(len(candles)):
82
83 c = candles[i]
84
85 # Logic Step 2.1: Typical Price
86 # [Why] Represents a fair approximation of price for that bar.
87 tp = (c['high'] + c['low'] + c['close']) / 3.0
88
89 vol = c['volume']
90
91 # Logic Step 2.2: Accumulate
92 # [Visual]
93 # Bar 1: Price 100, Vol 10. Val += 1000. Vol += 10. VWAP = 100.
94 # Bar 2: Price 110, Vol 100. Val += 11000. Vol += 100. VWAP = 12000/110 = 109.09.
95 # (Weighted heavily towards Bar 2 due to volume).
96 # [How] Add (TypicalPrice * Volume) to the cumulative value numerator. Add Volume to the cumulative volume denominator.
97
98 cum_tp_vol += (tp * vol)
99 cum_vol += vol
100
101 # Logic Step 2.3: Compute
102 # [Why] Calculate the final weighted average for this step.
103 # [How] Divide the cumulative price-volume product by the cumulative volume.
104 if cum_vol == 0:
105 self.values.append(None)
106 else:
107 vwap = cum_tp_vol / cum_vol
108 self.values.append(vwap)
109​
110​
111# =============================================================================
112# Static Wrapper Function
113# =============================================================================
114def calculate(candles):
115 vwap = VolumeWeightedAveragePrice()
116 vwap.calculate(candles)
117 return vwap.values
